thread.title: Trump asked South Korea officials to show flexibility in trade talks: Seoul

title: Trump asked South Korea officials to show flexibility in trade talks: Seoul
text: March 16, 2018 / 2:37 PM / Updated 7 hours ago Trump asked South Korea officials to show flexibility in trade talks: Seoul Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SEOUL (Reuters) -   asked South Korean officials to show flexibility in trade negotiations with the United States in a phone call with South Korean President Moon Jae-in, the Blue House said in a statement on Friday. FILE PHOTO:   and South Korea's President Moon Jae-in hold a joint press conference at the presidential Blue House in Seoul, South Korea, November 7, 2017. REUTERS/Jung Yeon-Je/Pool South Korea and the United States were scheduled to hold a third round of talks for amendments to an existing bilateral free trade agreement this week in Washington. Trump has repeatedly said the free trade deal with South Korea is “unfair” and has threatened to scrap it altogether on multiple occasions. Reporting by Christine Kim; Editing by Janet Lawrence
